abstract: The effort by Google, Yahoo and Microsoft has failed to attract other tech companies, raising questions about its impact.
snippet: The effort by Google, Yahoo and Microsoft has failed to attract other tech companies, raising questions about its impact.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  When Google, Yahoo and Microsoft signed a code of conduct intended to protect online free speech and privacy in restrictive countries, the debate over censorship by China was raging, and Internet companies operating there were under fire for putting profit ahead of principle.

headline.main: Sites Like Twitter Absent From Free Speech Pact
headline.print_headline: Sites Like Twitter Absent From Free Speech Pact

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
